section.title: Supported Hardware
section.p: The following servers are supported for the lifecycle manager host, and for the controllers and compute servers.
Lifecycle Manager Host The lifecycle manager host is a single server with at least a 40 GB disk size and 8,192 MB RAM.

Controllers and compute servers The following servers are supported for the controllers and compute servers in both the Non-KVM region and KVM region. The servers must meet the specifications in the Required Specifications table below:

ul.li: If you are using Gen9 systems, you must update the firmware to HPE Service Pack for ProLiant (SPP) Version 2015.06.0.
If you are using Gen8 systems, you will experience reduced performance.

p.note: For advanced features like SR-IOV, PCI Passthrough, one or more additional Intel Ethernet 10Gb 2-Port 560SFP NICs are required.

section.title: ESX and DCN Specifications
section.p: Consult the DCN and ESX documentation for the supported hardware and required hardware specifications.

section.title: Required Hardware Configurations
section.p: The servers, selected from the Supported Hardware lists, must be configured as follows for HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.
One (1) Lifecycle Manager Host. You must have a server with a 40GB Disk and 8,192 MB RAM for the lifecycle manager host. This server will also host the VSD VM.
Three (3) HP Helion OpenStack Controllers. You must have three (3) baremetal systems to install the HP Helion OpenStack controllers that meet the following requirements:

ul.li: For systems with multiple NICs, only one NIC may be active or connected.

Capable of hosting VMs
Important: Since the installer currently uses only the first available disk, all servers must have RAID controllers pre-configured to present their storage as a single, logical disk. RAID across multiple physical discs is strongly recommended for both performance and resilience.
Notes:
On the controller nodes, make sure the RAID array is configured to reflect a total size of less than 4TB.
The root volume cannot exceed 2TB

section.p: Two (2) KVM controllers. You must have two (2) baremetal systems to install the KVM region controllers. For systems with multiple NICs, only one NIC may be active or connected.
Two (2) KVM compute servers. You must have two (2) or more baremetal systems to install the KVM region compute servers.

ul.li:
KVM region NICs. The following NICs have been verified for PXE booting of KVM region servers:
Emulex 10G
Intel 82599
Important: Using the correct NICs is essential to proper installation of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.

section.title: DCN Components
section.p: If you are installing HP Distributed Cloud Networking (DCN), you need the following additional components. Refer to the DCN release notes for the supported hardware configurations.

ul.li:
Two (2) DCN hosts. You must have:
two (2) baremetal systems for DCN VSC controllers (HA mode) ; this system will host the VSC-VM.
two (2) baremetal systems for DCN VRS-G Software Gateway (HA mode); this system will host the VRS-G gateway.
VRSvApp requirements VRSvApp must be installed. Please Refer to the DCN VSP 3.2 R4 installation Guide for VRSvApp installation.

section.p: Note: The HP Distributed Cloud Networking (DCN) VSD must be installed and configured in the ESX region before installing HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.

section.title: ESX Components
section.p: If you are installing VMware vSphere, you need the following additional components. Refer to the ESX documentation for the supported hardware configurations.

Two (2) ESX hosts. You must have a minimum of two (2) baremetal systems for ESXi hosts. A minimum of 1 ESX cluster with two nodes. This cluster will host the ESX Compute Proxy. A VRSvApp deployment is required for each cluster.
One (1) to four (4) ESXi clusters are supported. Refer to the ESX documentation for the supported hardware configurations.
vSphere Cluster running ESXi 5.5u2 with vMotion enabled.
1 Virtual Machine Port Group with all Cloud VLANs associated to the Port Group.
Note: VMware vSphere 5.5 must be fully installed and operational before installing HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.

section.title: Ironic Baremetal Components
section.p:
If you are installing the Ironic baremetal region, you need the following additional components:
One (1) Controller. You must have one (1) HPE ProLiant DL360 or DL380 baremetal system to install the baremetal region controllers.

section.title: Software Requirements
section.p: Lifecycle Manager Host. The lifecycle manager host requires the Ubuntu Server 14.04.2 LTS operating system.
Non-KVM Region Controllers. The servers should be baremetal. The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation process installs the required software.
KVM Region Controllers. The servers should be baremetal. The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation process installs the required software.
KVM Region Compute. The servers should be baremetal. The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation process installs the required software.

section.title: ESX Software Requirements
section.p: VMware vSphere 5.5 must be fully installed and operational before installing HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.

section.p: HP Distributed Cloud Networking (DCN)

section.title: External Storage
section.p: The following back-end drivers are supported to enable management of the OpenStack Block Storage volumes in the non-KVM region.

ul.li: HPE 3PAR StoreServ, version 3.1.3 or 3.2.1 MU2 or higher .
HPE StoreVirtual VSA with LeftHand OS 11.5.

section.p: You will configure the installer to integrate one or both of these drivers during the installation process.

body.section:
Supported Guest Operating Systems The following guest operating systems (guest OSs) are supported for the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade servers.
Lifecycle Manager Host. There are no supported guest OSs for the Lifecycle Manager Host server.
Non-KVM Region Controllers. There are no supported guest OSs for the servers that host the HP Helion OpenStack Controllers.
KVM Region Compute and Controllers. The following Guest OSs are supported for the servers in the KVM region for both cloud topologies:
WindRiver Linux 6.0
WindRiver Linux 5.0
CentOS 6.4
Fedora 19
RHEL 6.5
OpenSUSE 12.3
